intro: Alyssum campestre proles fontqueri, commonly known as the coastal alyssum, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western coast of the United States. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring and early summer. The plant has compact, mat-forming foliage with silvery-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for coastal and rocky garden environments. Its botanical features make it a hardy and drought-tolerant plant ideal for erosion control and ornamental landscaping.
